RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 29700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 12 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEACON DOUGIE was bumped at the start, set a pressured pace along the inside into the turn, shook clear in upper stretch and prevailed under a strong hand ride. R CARDINAL PRINCE was also bumped at the start, trailed into the stretch then closed willingly in the four path and finished clear for second. COURTHOUSE COVE bumped with R CARDINAL PRINCE at the start, was allowed to settle, offered a mild bid three wide through the turn then leveled off. C J ALL THE WAY bumped with the winner at the start, pressed the early pace pressed between rivals while two wide then weakened on the turn. AWESOME ENOUGH pressed the pace three then two wide and was through after a half.

ENTRY.NAME: R Cardinal Prince
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, trailed, closed willingly, 4path, clear second

ENTRY.NAME: Courthouse Cove
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, middle move, 3 wide, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Deacon Dougie
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumpd start, set pace inside, drew clear upper stretch, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: C J All the Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, pressed between horses 2 wide, weakened turn

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Enough
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3-2wide, through after half,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 38400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 12 Allow ed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAISE THE PURSES chased the leader four wide into the stretch, responded readily when set down, rallied under mild right handed urging to make the lead late and drew off under a strong hand ride. GIV'EM THE BIZ was hustled to the lead soon after the start, set the pace along the inside until deep stretch then was no match for the winner. WETZEL chased the pace along the inside into the stretch and was outfinished in the two path. STONE COLD CAT trailed into the stretch and passed tiring rivals late outside. TURNING PAGES chased the pace three wide into the stretch then weakened. KEEPING SCORE was forwardly placed between rivals two wide into the stretch and gave way late.

ENTRY.NAME: Wetzel
ENTRY.OWNER: Pickerrell William D Pickerrell Joe and Cline Robert C
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, inside, outfinished 2path

ENTRY.NAME: Giv'em the Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, set pace late stretch, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Keeping Score
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 2 wide, gave way late

ENTRY.NAME: Turning Pages
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 3 wide, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Stone Cold Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rivals late outside

ENTRY.NAME: Raise the Purses
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 4 wide, rallied 2 wide, perfect trip, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Special Weight Purse 33900. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PENNY'S TREASURE chased the pace into stretch, closed willingly two wide under left handed urging through the final sixteenth of a mile and got up in the final strides. COUNTRY STYLE away alertly, set the pace under pressure early, shook clear on the turn, widened into the stretch and just missed hanging on. WINDY VALLEY had good early speed three wide, shifted out to the five path entering the stretch giving up ground then came on again late. DOMINUS O'S ME pressed the early pace two wide, chased the latter pace and was outfinished. CHIQ IN THE VALLEY had good early speed along the inside and was through after a half. J. P INDY was no threat. BOOKMASTER was outrun. VIVA LA MANANA was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Chiq in the Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside speed, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: J. P Indy
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Manana
ENTRY.COMMENT: through early,

ENTRY.NAME: Penny's Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, closed willingly, 2 wide, left handed urging, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Country Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, drew clear turn, just failed,

ENTRY.NAME: Dominus O's Me
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta Racing Stable and Quinteros Delia
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, chased, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Windy Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 3w, swung wide, lost ground, came again, 5path

ENTRY.NAME: Bookmaster
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 60. Allowance Purse 35800. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 12 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLAG RAISER bore in at the start bumping the runner up, battled for the early lead two wide, took over after a quarter, set the balance of the pace and widened through the stretch under strong urging to win as much the best. PROSECUTOR was bumped and forced inward at the start, chased the pace in the four path and finished clear for second. CHOCOLATE RABBIT never far back, went evenly two wide. INDY CARR trailed into the stretch, swung wide and passed tiring rivals in the eight path. CHILTEPIN failed to menace. BLAKE'S RYEN contested the early lead along the inside, chased the pace for a half then gave way. THE RIDER OF PROSECUTOR LODGED A CLAIM OF FOUL AGAINST THE RIDER OF FLAG RAISER FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE AT THE START. AFTER REVIEW THE STEWARDS UPHELD THE ORIGINAL ORDER OF FINISH.

ENTRY.NAME: Indy Carr
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, swung wide, passed tiring rivals 8path

ENTRY.NAME: Chocolate Rabbit
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, evenly 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Blake's Ryen
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace inside, gave way lane

ENTRY.NAME: Chiltepin
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Prosecutor
ENTRY.OWNER: Poe Racing Stable LLC and 8 and 3 Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, forced inward start, chased, no match,claimed foul

ENTRY.NAME: Flag Raiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore in, bumped start, dueled 2w, full of run, much the best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Miss Ohio S. THISTLEDOWN RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 68. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR FILLIES, TWO-YEAR-OLDS REGISTERED OHIO FOALS (WHICH REFLECTS $35,000 FROM THE OHIO THOROUGHBRED FUND). Foaled in the State of Ohio as per requirements set forth by the Ohio State Racing Commission. Nomination fee of $50. $350 to enter with an additio nal $650 to start, with a purse of $100,000, of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weights: 118 lbs. Nominations Close Wednesday August 2nd, 2023. Starters to be named through the entry box Mon day August 7th, 2023. A Trophy will be presented to the Winning Owner, Trainer, and Jockey. This stake will not split. In the event more than fourteen (14) horses pass the entry box at the time of closing of entries, preference will be given to those hors es having accumulated the highest 2022 earnings as published by Equibase. Fees to be refunded to excluded horses.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRACTICALLYELUSIVE was bumped at the start, sped to the lead inside rival soon thereafter, set all the pace, drifted to the four path entering the stretch, was put to mild right handed urging, drew clear before the furlong marker and won under confident handling. CITY SCENE drifted in at the start, had a brief early lead, chased the winner three then two wide, drew closer early on the turn, was carried out to the five path entering the stretch then was no match while well clear for second. KISS ME QUICK chased the early pace two wide and weakened on the turn. BRIEF ENCOUNTER bumped at the start and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Kiss Me Quick
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, weakened turn

ENTRY.NAME: Practicallyelusive
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Snow Racing Stables Boots N Bikinis LLC and Engelhart Joseph M
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, rushed to lead inside, drifted 4p top lane, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Brief Encounter
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, trailed,

ENTRY.NAME: City Scene
ENTRY.COMMENT: drifted in start, loomed boldly 2 wide turn, no match for winner,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Honey Jay S. THISTLEDOWN RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 102. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD, REGISTERED OHIO FOALS (WHICH REFLECTS $35,000 FROM THE OHIO THOROUGHBRED FUND). Foaled in the State of Ohio as per requirements set forth by the Ohio State Racing Commission. Nomination fee of $50. $350 to enter with an add itional $650 to start, with a purse of $100,000, of which 60% to winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Olds 119 lbs. Older 123. Non-Winners of $30,000 Twice in 2023 allowed 2 lbs. Two races oth er than Maiden, Claiming, Optional or Starter in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A race other Maiden, Claiming, Optional or Starter in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. Nominations Close Wednesday, August 2nd, 2023. Starters to be named through the entry box Monday August 7th, 202 3. A Trophy will be presented to the Winning Owner, Trainer, and Jockey. This stake will not split. In the event more than fourteen (14) horses pass the entry box at the time of closing of entries, preference will be given to those horses having accumulat
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIAMOND DUST prompted the early pace three then two wide through the turn, gained a narrow advantage at the top of the stretch, was asked with right handed urging nearing the furlong marker and edged clear late under brisk handling. MR LOOOCH stalked the pace from the three path into the stretch, rallied two wide through deep stretch and finished second best. ALTISSIMO stalked the pace four wide, drifted entering the stretch and finished with good courage in the six path. FAIR AND SQUARE drifted in at the start, rushed to the lead inside rivals, set a pressured pace to the top of the stretch then was outfinished. DOUGIE D ORO wide early, inched closer four wide on the turn then came up empty. MEDIA DARLING was antsy in the gate, pressed the early pace two wide, retreated on the turn and jogged to the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: Fair and Square
ENTRY.OWNER: WinStar Farm LLC and Blazing Meadows Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: drifted in start, set pressured pace inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Media Darling
ENTRY.COMMENT: antsy gate, pressed 2 wide, stopped lane

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Dust
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 3w, took over 2 wide top lane, edged clear, right urging

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Blazing Meadows Farm & WinStar Farm, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Loooch
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3path, late rally, 2 wide, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Dougie D Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide early, inched closer turn, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Altissimo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4 wide, finished well 6path

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Cleveland Kindergarten S. THISTLEDOWN RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 69. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TWO-YEARS-OLD REGISTERED OHIO FOALS (WHICH REFLECTS $35,000 FROM THE OHIO THOROUGHBRED FUND). Foaled in the State of Ohio as per requirements set forth by the Ohio State Racing Commission. Nomination fee of $50. $350 to enter with an additional $650 t o start, with a purse of $100,000, of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weights: 118 lbs. Fillies: 115 lbs. Nominations Close Wednesday, August 2nd, 2023. Starters to be named through the entr y box on Monday, August 7th, 2023. A Trophy will be presented to the Winning Owner, Trainer, and Jockey. This Stake will not be split. In the event more than fourteen (14) horses pass the entry box at the time of closing of entries, preference will be giv en to those horses having accumulated the highest 2023 earnings as published by Equibase. Fees to be refunded to excluded horses.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHO DEY stalked the pace in the four path through the turn, shifted out to the six path entering the stretch, rallied determinedly under right handed pressure to make the lead late and drew clear under brisk handling. SPELLCAST unhurried early, closed willingly behind the winner and finished second best. SHADOWY had speed from the start, moved closer three wide on the turn, drifted out to the nine path entering the stretch giving up ground then came on again late while drifting into the four path. SCRIMPER sprinted to the lead soon after the start, set a pressured pace until deep stretch then was outfinished. VILLIAN was no factor. HOTTIE SPOTTIE pressed the pace two wide into the stretch and gave way late. MOMMA K'S BOY was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Scrimper
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, set pressured pace off rail, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Who Dey
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4path, shifted 6path top lane, late burst, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Hottie Spottie
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, gave way late

ENTRY.NAME: Momma K's Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Spellcast
ENTRY.OWNER: WinStar Farm LLC and Blazing Meadows Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, closed willingly, 6path second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Villian
ENTRY.OWNER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC and Hamm Shane
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Shadowy
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, 3 wide, drifted 9path top lane, determinedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Pay the Man S. THISTLEDOWN RACE 8 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 88. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR FILLIES & MARES THREE-YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD REGISTERED OHIO FOALS (WHICH REFLECTS $35,000 FROM THE OHIO THOROUGHBRED FUND). Foaled in the State of Ohio as per requirements set forth by the Ohio State Racing Commission. Nomination fee of $50. $350 to en ter with an additional $650 to start, with a purse of $100,000, of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Olds 119 lbs. Older 123 lbs. Nominations Close Wednesday, August 2nd, 2 023. Starters to be named through the entry box Monday August 7th, 2023. A Trophy will be presented to the Winning Owner, Trainer, and Jockey. This stake will not split. In the event more than fourteen (14) horses pass the entry box at the time of closing of entries, preference will be given to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings as published by Equibase. Fees to be refunded to excluded horses.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CANDLELIGHT HOURS stalked the pace three wide while out in the seven path down the backstretch, angled inward on the far turn, rallied to make the lead three wide at the top of the stretch, drifted in nearing the furlong marker, was corrected with left handed urging and drew clear late. SONNET set the early pace off the rail in the five path, bumped with I RECALL repeatedly past the half mile marker, kept pressure two wide into the stretch, was in tight near the furlong marker and finished second best. I RECALL dropped the runner up before a half, was bumped repeatedly by that one nearing the far turn, set a pressured pace to the top of the stretch, was in tight at the furlong marker, altered course to the four path and was outfinished. MARKET SUCCESS raced widest of all and lacked the needed response. SHE'S CRAFTY was no threat. AUNT BEE was through after a half. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN AND THE RIDER OF SONNET LODGED A CLAIM OF FOUL AGAINST THE RIDER OF THE WINNER FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE IN THE STRETCH. AFTER REVIEW THE STEWARDS UPHELD THE ORIGINAL ORDER OF FINISH.

ENTRY.NAME: Market Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide trip, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Aunt Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: through after half

ENTRY.NAME: She's Crafty
ENTRY.OWNER: Poe Racing Stable LLC and 8 and 3 Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: I Recall
ENTRY.OWNER: Allen, Lowell F. and Bourke, W. John
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped inside 1/2p, bumped reptdly 7/16p, tight 1/8p, outfinish

ENTRY.NAME: Candlelight Hours
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 7w, rallied 3 wide far turn, drifted in1/8p,drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Sonnet
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace 6path, bumped repeatedly 7/16pole, tight 1/8p, foul

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Governor's Buckeye Cup S. THISTLEDOWN RACE 9 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 93. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD REGISTERED OHIO FOALS (WHICH REFLECTS $35,000 FROM THE OHIO THOROUGHBRED FUND). Foaled in the State of Ohio as per requirements set forth by the Ohio State Racing Commission. Nomination fee of $50. $350 to enter with an addi tional $650 to start, with a purse of $100,000, of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Olds 119 lbs. Older 123 lbs. Nominations Close Wednesday, August 2nd, 2023. Starters to be named through the entry box Monday, August 7th, 2023. A Trophy will be presented to the Winning Owner, Trainer, and Jockey. This stake will not split. In the event more than fourteen (14) horses pass the entry box at the time of closing of entries, pr eference will be given to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings as published by Equibase. Fees to be refunded to excluded horses.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I WANNA WIN away alertly, set the pace off the rail in the four and five paths into the stretch, was headed by the runner up nearing the furlong marker then fought back gamely under left handed urging to get back up in time. TANTRUM never far back, rallied two wide into the stretch in the seven path, gained a narrow lead near the furlong marker and just missed hanging on. SILENCE saved ground and went evenly. FOREWARNED failed to menace. OAKS HONEY chased thew winner two then three wide into the far then weakened. SAMMY'S SMILE raced widest of all and stopped on the second turn.

ENTRY.NAME: I Wanna Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, headed, fought back gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Oaks Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 2-3wide, weakened 2nd turn,

ENTRY.NAME: Sammy's Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide early, stopped far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Silence
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Forewarned
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Tantrum
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, rallied 2w, narrow lead stretch, just failed,
